revised_title: Infra-red Spectral Analysis of Polypeptides with Small Side Chains
tldr: The authors examined the infra-red spectra of synthetic polypeptides with small side chains, such as polymers of glycine and alanine. They observed the low-frequency region in the spectrum and made some observations on the CH stretching modes in poly-L-alanine. The results provide insights into the structure and properties of these polypeptides and their relationship to silk fibers.
